name: Driver Quest: In-car Entertainment
description:
Driver Quest is a short experimental game about playing an AR game in your car while driving at night.

Collect coins while avoiding other drivers, then spend them in the shop on more in-game time. If you run out of time, the AR overlay will turn off, leaving you alone in the dark.

Credits:

  • The game was made by me, Morgan Morrell-Frewen
  • Some testing was done by my brother, Josh Morrell-Frewen
  • Road Architect was used for the roads https://github.com/MicroGSD/RoadArchitect
  • SplineMesh was used for some fence and coin placement https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/tools/modeling/splinemesh-104989
  • I used some assets from Sci-Fi Environment https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/environments/sci-fi-environment-84496
  • Wire Fence was used for some fences https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/characters/wire-fence-67846
  • I needed some Rusty Cars https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/vehicles/rusty-cars-3437
  • Foliage Pack Free was used for the trees https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/vegetation/foliage-pack-free-66155
  • Some sound effects were made by ZStriefel https://www.gamedevmarket.net/member/ZStriefel/
  • Some sound effects were made by Cactus Bear OST Extraordinaire https://www.gamedevmarket.net/member/cactus-bear-ost-extraordinaire/
  • Some music was made by Audio Alchemist https://www.gamedevmarket.net/member/audio-alchemist/
  • Some voice samples were made by fusehive https://www.gamedevmarket.net/member/fusehive-com/
  • Some music was made by Andy Ray
  • Equivalent font https://www.1001fonts.com/equivalent-font.html
  • VCR OSD Mono font https://www.dafont.com/vcr-osd-mono.font
